oai_dc:dc.dc:title: VALIDATION OF MOVABLE-BED MODELING GUIDANCE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hughes, Steven A.
Fowler, Jimmy E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: movable bed
model validation
modeling guidance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A l-to-7.5 scale (midscale) movable-bed physical model was used to validate model scaling criteria selected as most appropriate for turbulence-dominated, erosion of sediment by waves. Two-dimensional flume tests successfully reproduced profile evolution observed in prototype-scale wave flume tests conducted in Germany under both regular and irregular wave conditions. For the case of regular waves, a sloping concrete revetment was exposed, thus validating the scaling guidance for use in studying scour at coastal structures. Comparisons between regular wave and irregular wave profile evolution indicated that best correspondence is achieved when the significant wave height equals the monochromatic wave height, although irregular wave profile evolution takes about twice as long.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
